member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute
member.summary: Configures a callback service implementation in a client application.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.AutomaticSessionShutdown
member.summary: Specifies whether to automatically close a session when a service closes a duplex session.
member.returns: if duplex callback objects automatically close a session when the service closes a duplex session; otherwise, . The default is .

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IEndpointBehavior#AddBindingParameters(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection)
member.summary: Configures the binding elements to support the callback behavior.
member.param: The endpoint for the callback object.
The collection of binding parameters that are configured.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IEndpointBehavior#ApplyClientBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime)
member.summary: Configures the client runtime to support the callback object.
member.param: The endpoint configured by the attribute.
The client run-time object that the attribute configures.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IEndpointBehavior#ApplyDispatchBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointDispatcher)
member.summary: Implementation of the method. This implementation has no effect.
member.param: The endpoint to be modified.
The endpoint dispatcher that the method modifies.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IEndpointBehavior#Validate(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint)
member.summary: Validates the endpoint description prior to building the runtime.
member.param: The endpoint to be validated.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.CallbackBehaviorAttribute.UseSynchronizationContext
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to use the current synchronization context to choose the thread of execution.
member.returns: if all calls to the service must run on the thread specified by the ; otherwise, . The default value is .

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DuplexChannelFactory`1
member.summary: Provides the means to create and manage duplex channels of different types that are used by clients to send and receive messages to and from service endpoints.
member.typeparam: The type of channel produced by the channel factory.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DuplexChannelFactory`1.#ctor(System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext,System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a context that implements the callback contract and a specified binding.
member.param: The that the client uses to listen for messages from the connected service.
The used to connect to the service by channels produced by the factory.

member.param: The that the client uses to listen for messages from the connected service.

member.param: The that the client uses to listen for messages from the connected service.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DuplexClientBase`1
member.summary: Used to create a channel to a duplex service and associate that channel with a callback object.
member.typeparam: The type of the channel to be created.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DuplexClientBase`1.#ctor(System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified callback object.
member.param: An object that associates the callback object with the channel to the service.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified callback object, binding, and service endpoint address.
member.param: An object used to create the instance context that associates the callback object with the channel to the service.

The service endpoint address to use.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified callback object and configuration name.
member.param: An object used to create the instance context that associates the callback object with the channel to the service.
The name of the client endpoint information in the application configuration file.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext
member.summary: Represents the context information for a service instance.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a specified object that implements the service instance.
member.param: The object that implements the service instance.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.Extensions
member.summary: Gets the extension collection, if any, associated with the service instance.
member.returns: The of type that contains the instance contexts for the extensions of the service instance.
member.exception: The service instance associated with this context is closed, but was not aborted.
The service instance associated with this context is in a faulted state.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.GetServiceInstance(System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message)
member.summary: Returns the instance of the service for the instance context in response to an incoming message.
member.param: The incoming message that triggered the creation of a service object.
member.returns: The object that represents the service instance.
member.exception: The service instance is in a created or opening state or is not initialized.
The service instance has been closed already and cannot be modified in these states.
The service instance is faulted and cannot be modified in these states.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: Gets or sets the context used for thread synchronization with the current instance context.
member.returns: The used for thread synchronization with the current instance context.
member.exception: The communication object is opened or closing and cannot be modified in these states.
The communication object has been aborted and cannot be modified in these states.
The communication object has been closed already and cannot be modified in these states.
The communication object is faulted and cannot be modified in these states.
